name: The Vira Bali Hotel

reviews.text: Rooms are not massive but the balcony is good. Deluxe pool access is great value less than $100 a night. Breakfast is good with large selection including eggs and bacon. Staff were all well trained and very friendly.
reviews.title: Overall good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and could not fault it. Our room was an excellent size and had direct pool access. All the staff that we dealt with were warm and friendly and went out of their way to help you. We would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to any of our friends and family who a looking for a reasonably priced hotel away from the hustle and bustle.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is that we totally agree with great comments on this hotel. We have stayed in Bali many times but this is the first time at the Vira (only picked it cause it had a pool access room available on very short notice). This is the best value for money that we have experienced. Not only were the rooms well appointed, clean and although on the small side well set out so they are heaps big enough. The staff are great, easily understood us, and always had a smile. We had a issue with our toilet and within ten minutes of reporting it we had maintenance staff at our door, that is unheard of usually in Bali you generally have to wait and wait and report it at least twice before things are fixed. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a wonderfully relaxing holiday. We will be coming back in June with the family that is for sure. Thanks to everyone at the Vira
reviews.title: Absolutely terrific value for money

reviews.text: Our room on the 4th Floor was overlooking the pool, and comforatble, with a nice bathroom attached. No complaints on the room at all - it was modern with a flat-screen TV, and more cable channels than I had time to watch :))
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and conveniently located

reviews.text: It has a welcoming, simple lobby, breakfast was fine (pancakes were awesome!).
reviews.title: second time in hotel and even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think Kuta is really rather revolting, so tacky and so touristy, but I came to Bali this time with my new boyfriend who had never been so staying in Kuta was convenient for this trip.
reviews.title: A lovely little boutique hotel so close to the heart of Kuta
Nice Place
reviews.text: We stayed at the Vira Bali for 4 nights from October 20-24 and I was really happy with it!

It was small but with a lovely pool, the room was simple but clean and had everything we needed including great airconditioning and a tiny balcony which was lovely sitting out on it looking over the pool just after we woke up.
reviews.title: Great value, friendly service, excellent accomodation.

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was okay, not marvellous (no bacon unless it appears, you asked, which we didn't find out until after breakfast on the last day so I am not sure how other people knew this and the freshly cooked pancakes or eggs, the chefs found it very hard to speak english so it was hard to say what we wanted) but it truly was fine and filled us up.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and the staff (everyone) super friendly and very welcoming.

reviews.text: The location was great, it wasn't smack bang in Kuta but was only a 10 minute walk into the heart of it, and that is at a stroll, walking past plenty of money changers and Waterbom Park to get there, the first part of the centre that you get to being the Kuta Art Market (I think its called) which doesn't really have art, just everything else the Bali vendors sell, lots in one place!
reviews.title: Balinese Treat - Cozy little hotel..

reviews.text: great small hotel but the swimming pool is too small and the surrounding area is too confined but otherwise the staff were wonderful and the rooms perfect.
reviews.title: the friendliest people in bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First 3 nights in Bali at Vira, All Staff were Very friendly, helpful, always smiling
reviews.title: Excellent service, close to everything

reviews.text: and very good english. Short walk to everything, Great breakfast Only disappointment
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: was evening meal in restaurant. Good value for money. Boutique style.welcoming
reviews.title: Wonderful Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Vira Bali for three nights at the end of our month long stay in Bali. Had stayed at another Tuban hotel at the beginning of our holiday and Vira far exceeded the quality and value of that hotel. The rooms at Vira were stock standard, but the staff were excellent - spoke very good english and and appeared to want to truely interact and engage with you. For our purposes the location was excellent - handy to many excellent resturants and reasonably close to the beach (access was easy). I would definitely opt to stay at this hotel again - excellent value for money.
reviews.title: The BEST hotel ever!

reviews.text: The Vira Bali is the most beautiful place we have ever stayed! The rooms and pool area are so comfortable and relaxing. The restaurant and bar areas are lovely with extremely prompt and friendly service, along with great food and cocktails! Last but certainly not least here are the beautiful friendly staff who have made our holiday so much more enjoyable and really easy! We would love to come back to Bali and stay here again! :)
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at The Vira for 10 days with my partner and we had the best time there. The staff were very friendly, the food was great. The best aspect was the pool 3 metres outside our room as we stayed on the ground floor. It was perfect. The room was airconditioned and comfortable, the bathroom had everything we needed including a bath which is a must for me! The location was good, it was about a 20 min walk to kuta which wasnt too bad with all the shops and markets on the way. We hired a moped so it was easy to get around anyway. The staff would stop the traffic for us to enter safely which was thoughtful.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever

reviews.text: All in all an amazing place and I would recommend it to anyone. I am going back in March and have booked a room at the Vira again, cant wait to get back there.
reviews.title: Little slice of tranquility

reviews.text: The Vira Bali was exactly what I was hoping for in a boutique hotel for a short stay. The room was perfect, the service was beyond excellent (thank you Made, Duty Manager) and the location was ideal. Me and my 21 year old daughter found the pool extremely relaxing and the beds very comfortable. If service is important to you, this is the place to stay. Any issues we had (we needed outlet adapters and had trouble with the free wifi) were immediately addressed and taken care of, and always service with a smile. We're looking forward to our next visit to Bali and will definitely stay at The Vira Bali again. Oh! the banana pancakes at the restaurant there were excellent!!! Good free breakfast, definitely a plus:) Thanks again to the wonderful staff at the Vira Bali, we can't wait to visit again!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Adequate Location, Spoilt by the Management

reviews.text: The hotel is a little outside the main tourist district of Kuta, about 10-15 minutes walk. There are, however, several good restaurants in the local area, and a good supermarket and money changer just over the road.
reviews.title: Very pleasant place to stay

description: The charm of a boutique property combines with the convenience central location in downtown Kuta.
